node.title: Adam Schiff Says House 'Averted' Shutdown, Vote Now Goes to Senate
node.alt: The House of Representatives passed a continuing resolution to temporarily avoid a government shutdown, but the measure faces an uphill battle in the Senate. Shown above is the rotunda of the U.S. Capitol building in Washington, D.C.
node.description: The vote was passed along party lines, 221-212. Representative Adam Kinzinger was the only Republican to join the Democrats in voting "yes."
node.content:
["California Representative Adam Schiff said that the House of Representatives passed a continuing resolution Thursday to temporarily avert a government shutdown, but the vote now faces an uphill battle in the Senate.", "By a vote of 221-212, the resolution passed along mostly partisan lines. Representative Adam Kinzinger of Illinois was the only Republican to join the Democrats in voting \"yes.\"", "However, despite the motion making its way through the House, it is likely to encounter stiff opposition in the Senate, particularly from a number of GOP members who have stated they won't budge on a deal.", "Many of these Republicans have stated that they will delay the bill over President Joe Biden's vaccine mandate for small businesses, threatening to curtail any hope of avoiding a shutdown.", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated with additional information. ", "", "
The House of Representatives passed a continuing resolution to temporarily avoid a government shutdown, but the measure faces an uphill battle in the Senate. Shown above is the rotunda of the U.S. Capitol building in Washington, D.C.
"]
